description.narrative: At the project-level, (i) the Project will increase the productivity, access to markets, and food security for 15,000 barley farmers. With the support of IFC Advisory Services, Habesha hopes to reach 14,000 additional farmers through a system of forward contracting with cooperative unions and a linked system of input distribution. (ii) Through the project, IFC expects 500 direct, full-time jobs will be created. (iii) The Project will help accelerate the adoption of high-yield seed among malt barley farmers in Ethiopia, through capacity building and demonstration and replication effects, thus strengthening integration in the supply chain. At the market-level, IFC anticipates its investment in Habesha will encourage changes to existing malt barley markets in Ethiopia by increasing integration in the supply chain, through capacity building and demonstration and replication effects.

The proposed investment is a syndicated facility of up to 70 million, comprised of an A Loan of up to 30 million and B Loans of up to 45 million, to Habesha Breweries S.C. (Habesha or the Company), one of the leading beer brewers in Ethiopia. The investment is to support the Companys 131 million capacity expansion program which will be complemented by an advisory services program to support local barley farmers in the country.
